author: End of Novelty dot com
text:
Don’t use StockX. 

If you buy an item from stockX, and they send you a tampered-with item, this is their crappy condescending patronizing response (to someone who has spent thousands of dollars on their site):

Hello, we are sorry to hear about this issue! We can assure you that prior to shipping the item to the buyer, we verify it in-person with our authentication experts who inspect each item to ensure that it meets our condition standards. This is also stated on our FAQ, and you can always reach out to stockx if you have any questions regarding this. However once we take a look at the item and it is within the condition standards buyer are encouraged to resell on Stockx if they do not wish to keep. Thanks!

Don’t use StockX. 

Watch. They’re probably going to copypasta the same response below.
title: Don’t use StockX

author: meln
text:
Ordered a PS5 for my son on Tuesday Dec 17th. The seller shipped same day, and they got it on the 18th. Thursday the 19th it was verified. THEY SAT ON IT FOR 4 DAYS THE WEEK BEFORE CHRISTMAS, THEN MAILED IT VIA GROUND TRANSPORTATION!!! 

This company literally exists for materialistic people - why didn't they have extra people working to get verified items out immediately during the most materialistic holiday? They never had an option for expedited shipping, and block their customers from calling the shipper directly to change it. Not surprising in December, the package was delayed by weather. It is now January 9th, and we STILL DON'T HAVE IT!

This is an excellent business model, but VERY poorly executed.
title: Can't figure out how Christmas presents work
